The answer is: the manas consciousness that arises with the mind and dharmas as conditions is called the manas consciousness element.
The questions and answers and distinctions regarding this are to be understood as in the case of the eye consciousness element.
Question: Why are the six consciousness elements not said to have their own class?
Answer: The reason why it should be said but is not said is
that this meaning should be known to have a remainder.
Furthermore, the six consciousness elements are manifested by birth.
The mind that has its own class is established based on birth.
Because it is not born, it is only said to have its own class.
Furthermore, the six consciousness elements are manifested by function.
The mind that has its own class is established based on function.
Because it has no function, it is only said to have its own class.
Furthermore, the six consciousness elements are all included in the manas element.
It has already been said that the manas element has its own class.
It should be known that the six consciousness elements have already been discussed.
Therefore, they are not discussed again.
Question: If that is so,
then the six consciousnesses should not be established as the six sense bases,
because these six are already included in the sense base of mind.
Answer: Although they are the same as the sense base of mind, they are established separately,

because the three - sense faculty, object, and consciousness - each have six distinctions, so the six consciousnesses are distinguished separately. Question: In the sutras, the mind, thought, and consciousness are mentioned.
What is the difference between these three?
Some say:
There is no difference.
The mind is the same as thought, and thought is the same as consciousness.
Because these three terms have no different meanings.
It is like fire,ğŸ”½which is also called flame,ğŸ”½also called blazing,
also called producing light,ğŸ”½also called receiving offerings,
also called cooking,
also called black path,ğŸ”½also called drilling wood,
also called smoke banner,
also called golden appearance.
In this way, one fire has ten names.
Although the sounds are different, the substance is not different.
It is like Indra, who is also called Åšakra,
It is also called Purandara.
It is also called MÄra.ğŸ”½It is also called VÄsava.ğŸ”½It is also called KauÅ›ika.
It is also called ÅšacÄ«pati.
It is also called Indra.
It is also called Thousand-eyed.
It is also called Lord of the Thirty-three Celestials.
Thus one lord has ten names.
Although the sounds are different, the essence is not different.
As the Abhidharma says, feeling is called feeling.ğŸ”½It is also called equal feeling.
It is also called distinct feeling.ğŸ”½It is also called feeling of awareness.
It is also called feeling of pursuit.
Thus one feeling has five names.
Although the sounds are different, the essence is not different.
Therefore the sutra says that mind, thought, and consciousness are three.
Although the sounds are different, there is no distinction.
Furthermore, there is another explanation.
Mind, thought, and consciousness are also distinguished.
Name is precisely the distinction.
Because the names mind, thought, and consciousness are different.
Furthermore, time is also distinguished.
That which is past is called thought.
The future is called mind.
The present is called consciousness.
Moreover, there are also differences in designation.ğŸ”½That is to say, in the realms, mind is designated.
In the sense bases, intention is designated.
In the aggregates, consciousness is designated.
Moreover, there are also differences in meaning.ğŸ”½That is to say, mind has the meaning of a lineage.
Intention has the meaning of a source of birth.
Consciousness has the meaning of an accumulation.
Moreover, there are also differences in function.
That is to say, the function of mind is to travel far.
As a verse says:
It can travel far and alone, its body hidden in a cave.
One who subdues this mind is liberated from great fear.
The function of intention is to lead the way.
As a verse says:
The mind leads the way for all dharmas, the mind is the foremost, the mind draws them along.
The mind makes them pure or defiled, like a shadow following the form.
The function of consciousness is to continue rebirth.
As a sutra says:
If consciousness were absent when entering the mother's womb,
the kalala and so forth would not be accomplished.
Therefore, we know that the function of consciousness is to continue life.
Next, coloring is the function of mind.
As a sutra says:
Bhiká¹£us should know.
In the animal realm, due to the coloring of the mind,
there are various colors.
Returning is the function of intention.
As a sutra says:
Bhiká¹£us should know.
Thus, each of the five faculties has its own domain and its own objects.
The faculty of intention collectively receives the objects of their domains.
The intention returns to them and performs various activities.
Discerning is the function of consciousness.
As a sutra says:
Bhiká¹£us should know.
Consciousness is able to discern various objects.
Next, nourishing is the function of mind.ğŸ”½Cogitation is the function of intention.
Discernment is the function of consciousness.
Venerable PÄrÅ›va said:ğŸ”½Nourishing and dividing is the function of mind.
Cogitation and reflection is the function of intention.
Discernment and understanding is the function of consciousness.
One should know that here, nourishing refers to defiled mind.
Distinguishing is the undefiled mind.ğŸ”½Cognition is the defiled mind.
Contemplation is the undefiled mind.
Discrimination is the defiled consciousness.
Understanding is the undefiled consciousness.
The three of mind, cognition, and consciousness are called distinctions.
Question: Are the eye, form, and eye-consciousness realms necessarily of the same realm?
Or are there also those of different realms?
Answer: These three kinds may be of the same realm or of different realms.
How are they of the same realm?
It means when one born in the desire realm sees forms of the desire realm with eyes of the desire realm,
those eyes of the desire realm and forms of the desire realm give rise to eye-consciousness of the desire realm.
When one sees forms of the first dhyÄna with eyes of the first dhyÄna,
those eyes of the first dhyÄna and forms of the first dhyÄna give rise to eye-consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
If one born in the first dhyÄna sees forms of the first dhyÄna with eyes of the first dhyÄna,
those eyes of the first dhyÄna and forms of the first dhyÄna give rise to eye-consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
This is called the same bondage. What is different bondage?
It means when born in the desire realm, using the eyes of the first meditation to see forms of the desire realm,
the eyes of the first meditation and the forms of the desire realm give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When using the eyes of the second meditation to see forms of the desire realm,
the eyes of the second meditation and the forms of the desire realm give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the first meditation,
the eyes of the second meditation and the forms of the first meditation give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the second meditation,
the eyes of the second meditation and the forms of the second meditation give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When using the eyes of the third meditation to see forms of the desire realm,
the eyes of the third meditation and the forms of the desire realm give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the first meditation,
the eyes of the third meditation and the forms of the first meditation give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the second meditation,

When the eye of the third concentration sees the form of the third concentration, the eye of the third concentration and the form of the third concentration give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it sees the form of the third concentration,
the eye of the third concentration and the form of the third concentration give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it uses the eye of the fourth concentration to see the form of the desire realm,
the eye of the fourth concentration and the form of the desire realm give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it sees the form of the first concentration,
the eye of the fourth concentration and the form of the first concentration give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it sees the form of the second concentration,
the eye of the fourth concentration and the form of the second concentration give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it sees the form of the third concentration,
the eye of the fourth concentration and the form of the third concentration give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
When it sees the form of the fourth concentration,
the eye of the fourth concentration
and the form of the fourth concentrationğŸ”½give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first concentration.
If born in the first concentration,
When the eye of the first dhyÄna sees forms of the desire realm,
that eye of the first dhyÄna,
the forms of the desire realm give rise to eye consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
The rest is explained in detail as in the case of being born in the desire realm.
If one is born in the second, third, or fourth dhyÄna,
the detailed explanation should be understood according to the corresponding characteristics.
Can there be an eye belonging to a different realm, forms belonging to a different realm,
and an eye consciousness belonging to a different realm? The answer is yes.
This refers to when the eye of the second dhyÄna sees forms of the desire realm,
that eye of the second dhyÄna and the forms of the desire realm give rise to eye consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
When the eye of the third dhyÄna sees forms of the desire realm,
that eye of the third dhyÄna and the forms of the desire realm give rise to eye consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
When seeing forms of the second dhyÄna,
that eye of the third dhyÄna and the forms of the second dhyÄna give rise to eye consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
When the eye of the fourth dhyÄna sees forms of the desire realm,
that eye of the fourth dhyÄna and the forms of the desire realm give rise to eye consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
When seeing the form of the second dhyÄna,
the eye of the fourth dhyÄna and the form of the second dhyÄna give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
When seeing the form of the third dhyÄna,
the eye of the fourth dhyÄna and the form of the third dhyÄna give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
In this way, these three are each bound to different levels.
This is the meaning of the eye, form, and consciousness being either bound together or bound separately.
Question: Are the elements of body, eye, form, and eye-consciousness necessarily bound together?
Or are they also bound separately?
Answer: These four kinds are either bound together or bound separately.
How are they bound together?
It means when one born in the desire realm sees forms of the desire realm with eyes of the desire realm,
the body of the desire realm, the eyes of the desire realm, the forms of the desire realm give rise to the eye-consciousness of the desire realm.
If one born in the first dhyÄna sees forms of the first dhyÄna with eyes of the first dhyÄna,
the body of the first dhyÄna, the eyes of the first dhyÄna, the forms of the first dhyÄna give rise to the eye-consciousness of the first dhyÄna.
This is called being bound together.
What is meant by different realms?
It means when one born in the desire realm sees forms of the desire realm with eyes of the first dhyÄna,
their body belongs to the desire realm, their eyes belong to the first dhyÄna, the forms belong to the desire realm, and the eye consciousness arises in the first dhyÄna.
When seeing forms of the first dhyÄna,
their body belongs to the desire realm, their eyes belong to the first dhyÄna, the forms and eye consciousness both belong to the first dhyÄna.
When using the eyes of the second dhyÄna to see forms of the desire realm,
their body belongs to the desire realm, their eyes belong to the second dhyÄna, the forms belong to the desire realm,
and the eye consciousness arises in the first dhyÄna.
When seeing forms of the first dhyÄna,
their body belongs to the desire realm, their eyes belong to the second dhyÄna, the forms belong to the first dhyÄna, and the eye consciousness arises in the first dhyÄna.
When seeing forms of the second dhyÄna,
their body belongs to the desire realm, their eyes belong to the second dhyÄna, the forms and eye consciousness both belong to the second dhyÄna.
When using the eyes of the third dhyÄna to see forms of the desire realm,
When that desire realm body, third concentration eye sees desire realm form, first concentration eye consciousness arises.
When seeing first concentration form,
that desire realm body, third concentration eye, first concentration form generates first concentration eye consciousness.
When seeing second concentration form,
that desire realm body, third concentration eye, second concentration form generates first concentration eye consciousness.
When seeing third concentration form,
that desire realm body, third concentration eye, third concentration form generates first concentration eye consciousness.
When that very [body] sees desire realm form with fourth concentration eye,
that desire realm body, fourth concentration eye, desire realm form generates first concentration eye consciousness.
When seeing first concentration form,
that desire realm body, fourth concentration eye, first concentration form generates first concentration eye consciousness.
When seeing second concentration form,ğŸ”½...
When the body belongs to the desire realm, the eyes to the fourth meditation, the form to the second meditation, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation,

and one sees the form of the third meditation, the body belongs to the desire realm, the eyes to the fourth meditation, the form to the third meditation, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation.
When one sees the form of the fourth meditation,
the body belongs to the desire realm, the eyes to the fourth meditation, the form to the fourth meditation, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation.
If one is born in the first meditation,
when one uses the eyes of the first meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes to the first meditation, the form to the desire realm, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation.
When one uses the eyes of the second meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes to the second meditation, the form to the desire realm, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation.
When one sees the form of the first meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes to the second meditation, the form to the first meditation, and the visual consciousness to the first meditation.
When one sees the form of the second meditation,
When the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes to the second meditation, the form to the second meditation, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation,
when one with that [body] uses the eyes of the third meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes of the third meditation, the form of the desire realm, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the first meditation,
the body belongs to the desire realm, the eyes of the third meditation, the form of the first meditation, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the second meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes of the third meditation, the form of the second meditation, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the third meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes of the third meditation, the form of the third meditation, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation.
When one with that [body] uses the eyes of the fourth meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eyes of the fourth meditation, the form of the desire realm, and the eye consciousness to the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the first meditation,
When the body belongs to the first meditation, the eye belongs to the fourth meditation, the form belongs to the first meditation, and the eye consciousness arises from the first meditation,
when seeing the form of the second meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eye belongs to the fourth meditation, the form belongs to the second meditation, and the eye consciousness arises from the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the third meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eye belongs to the fourth meditation, the form belongs to the third meditation, and the eye consciousness arises from the first meditation.
When seeing the form of the fourth meditation,
the body belongs to the first meditation, the eye belongs to the fourth meditation, the form belongs to the fourth meditation, and the eye consciousness arises from the first meditation.
Just as when born in the first meditation,
when born in the second, third, and fourth meditations,
the explanation should be known according to the corresponding characteristics.
There is a difference.ğŸ”½If born in the second meditation, the body should always be said to belong to the second meditation.
If born in the third meditation, the body should always be said to belong to the third meditation.
If born in the fourth meditation, one should always speak of the body of the fourth meditation.
Can there be a body belonging to one realm, eyes belonging to another realm, forms belonging to another realm, and eye-consciousness belonging to another realm?
The answer is yes.
When one born in the desire realm uses the eyes of the third meditation to see the forms of the second meditation,
at that time, their desire realm body, the eyes of the third meditation, the forms of the second meditation, and the eye-consciousness of the first meditation arise.
When they use the eyes of the fourth meditation to see the forms of the second meditation,
at that time, their desire realm body, the eyes of the fourth meditation, the forms of the second meditation, and the eye-consciousness of the first meditation arise.
When seeing the forms of the third meditation,
at that time, their desire realm body, the eyes of the fourth meditation, the forms of the third meditation, and the eye-consciousness of the first meditation arise.
If born in the second meditation,
when using the eyes of the third meditation to see the forms of the desire realm,
at that time, their second meditation body, the eyes of the third meditation, the forms of the desire realm, and the eye-consciousness of the first meditation arise.
When one uses the eye of the fourth meditation to see forms of the desire realm,
one's body is in the second meditation, the eye is in the fourth meditation, the forms are in the desire realm, and the eye consciousness arises in the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the third meditation,
one's body is in the second meditation, the eye is in the fourth meditation, the forms are in the third meditation, and the eye consciousness arises in the first meditation.
If one is born in the third meditation and uses the eye of the fourth meditation to see forms of the desire realm,
one's body is in the third meditation, the eye is in the fourth meditation, the forms are in the desire realm, and the eye consciousness arises in the first meditation.
When seeing forms of the second meditation,
one's body is in the third meditation, the eye is in the fourth meditation, the forms are in the second meditation, and the eye consciousness arises in the first meditation.
In this way, these four are each bound to different stages.ğŸ”½This is the meaning of the body, eye, form, and consciousness being either bound together or bound separately.
Just as it is explained that the eye element, form element, eye consciousness element, and body are either bound together or bound separately,
The same applies to the ear, sound, and ear-consciousness elements, and to the body element.
Question: Are the nose, smells, and nose-consciousness elements necessarily of the same realm?
Or are there also those of different realms?
Answer: These three are only of the same realm.
That is, the nose of the desire realm produces smells of the desire realm, and the nose-consciousness of the desire realm arises.
Although there are other realms of the nose, there are no smells or nose-consciousness.
Therefore, this is not discussed.
Question: Are the body, nose, smells, and nose-consciousness elements necessarily of the same realm?
Or are there also those of different realms?
Answer: These four are only of the same realm.
That is, the body of the desire realm produces the nose of the desire realm, smells of the desire realm, and the nose-consciousness of the desire realm arises.

Although there are other realms of the body and nose elements, there are no smells or nose-consciousness. Therefore, this is not discussed.ğŸ”½Just as the nose element, smell element, nose-consciousness element, and body are only of the same realm,
so are the tongue element, taste element, tongue-consciousness element, and body only of the same realm.
The detailed explanation should be understood according to the corresponding principles.
Are the body, tangibles, and body consciousness necessarily of the same realm?
Or can they also be of different realms?
Answer: These three kinds
may be of the same realm or of different realms.
What is meant by being of the same realm?
If born in the desire realm, the body is of the desire realm, the tangibles are of the desire realm, and the body consciousness is born of the desire realm.
If born in the first dhyana, the body is of the first dhyana, the tangibles are of the first dhyana, and the body consciousness is born of the first dhyana.
This is called being of the same realm.
What is meant by being of different realms?
If born in the second dhyana, the body is of the second dhyana, the tangibles are of the second dhyana, and the body consciousness is born of the first dhyana.
If born in the third dhyana, the body is of the third dhyana, the tangibles are of the third dhyana, and the body consciousness is born of the first dhyana.
If born in the fourth dhyana, the body is of the fourth dhyana, the tangibles are of the fourth dhyana, and the body consciousness is born of the first dhyana.
This is called being of different realms. The body and tangibles are necessarily not of different realms,
because consciousness arises only when the sense faculty and object come together.
because the coarseness and subtlety of faculties and objects must correspond.
Here, there are no four corresponding same and different realms, because there is no separate basis for the body.
Question: Are the realms of mind, dharmas, and mental consciousness necessarily of the same realm?
Or can they also be of different realms?
Answer: These three kinds
may be of the same realm or of different realms.
How are they of the same realm?
It means that when the mind of the desire realm gives rise to dharmas of the desire realm, it produces the mental consciousness of the desire realm.
Up to the mind of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
the dharmas of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
give rise to the mental consciousness of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
This is called being of the same realm.
How are they of different realms?
Some say:ğŸ”½Immediately after a wholesome mind of the desire realm, only the present preliminary concentration can appear.
Immediately after the preliminary concentration, a wholesome mind of the desire realm appears.
Some say:
Immediately after a wholesome mind of the desire realm, either the preliminary concentration or the first meditation appears.
The wholesome mind of the desire realm appears immediately after those two.
There is another explanation.
The wholesome mind of the desire realm is immediately followed by the preliminary concentration, or the first meditation, or the intermediate meditation, which appear.
Those three are immediately followed by the wholesome mind of the desire realm.
The Venerable SubhÅ«ti says this.
The wholesome mind of the desire realm is immediately followed by the preliminary concentration, or the first meditation, or the intermediate meditation, or the second meditation, which appear.
Those four are immediately followed by the wholesome mind of the desire realm.
Just as when skipping meditation, the first meditation, etc. is immediately skipped, and the second meditation, etc. appears.
The judges say.
They should not say this.
Because the arising of the minds of concentration and non-concentration is different.
It should be said like this.ğŸ”½The wholesome mind of the desire realm is immediately followed by the preliminary concentration or the first meditation.
Those two are immediately followed by the wholesome mind of the desire realm.
Because the power of the uninterrupted [path] can only reach this [level].
That is, when a wholesome mind of the desire realm is immediately followed by either the stage of access concentration or the first meditative absorption,
the mental faculty of the desire realm and the mental consciousness of the first meditative absorption have objects that are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When the wholesome mind of the desire realm is immediately followed by the two [minds],
the mental faculty of the desire realm and the mental consciousness of the first meditative absorption have objects that are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
Immediately after the first meditative absorption, when one enters the second meditative absorption in the forward order,
the mental faculty of the first meditative absorption and the mental consciousness of the second meditative absorption have objects that are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
Immediately after the second meditative absorption, when one enters the first meditative absorption in the reverse order,
the mental faculty of the second meditative absorption and the mental consciousness of the first meditative absorption have objects that are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
Immediately after the second meditative absorption, when one enters the third meditative absorption in the forward order,
the mental faculty of the second meditative absorption and the mental consciousness of the third meditative absorption have objects that are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
Either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When entering the second meditation in reverse order immediately after the third meditation,
the mind of the third meditation, the mental consciousness of the second meditation, and the dharmas,
either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When entering the fourth meditation in forward order immediately after the third meditation,
the mind of the third meditation, the mental consciousness of the fourth meditation, and the dharmas,
either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When entering the third meditation in reverse order immediately after the fourth meditation,
the mind of the fourth meditation, the mental consciousness of the third meditation, and the dharmas,
either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When entering the sphere of infinite space in forward order immediately after the fourth meditation,
the mind of the fourth meditation, the mental consciousness of the sphere of infinite space, and the dharmas,
either bound to the formless realm or unbound.
When entering the fourth meditation in reverse order immediately after the sphere of infinite space,
The mind of that sphere of infinite space is the fourth meditative absorption, and the mental factors are dharmas.
They may be bound to the three realms or unconditioned.
When entering the sphere of infinite consciousness immediately and sequentially from the sphere of infinite space,

the mind of that sphere of infinite space is the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the mental factors are dharmas.ğŸ”½They may be bound to the sphere of infinite consciousness, the sphere of nothingness,
the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
or unconditioned.
When entering the sphere of infinite space immediately and reversely from the sphere of infinite consciousness,
the mind of that sphere of infinite consciousness is the sphere of infinite space, and the mental factors are dharmas.
They may be bound to the formless realm or unconditioned.
When entering the sphere of nothingness immediately and sequentially from the sphere of infinite consciousness,
the mind of that sphere of infinite consciousness is the sphere of nothingness, and the mental factors are dharmas.
They may be bound to the sphere of nothingness,
the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
or unconditioned.
When entering the sphere of infinite consciousness immediately and reversely from the sphere of nothingness,
The consciousness of the sphere of nothingness and the sphere of infinite consciousness are either bound to the sphere of infinite consciousness or bound to the sphere of nothingness.
Or they are bound to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
Or they are unbound.
Immediately after the sphere of nothingness, in sequence, entering the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
the mind of the sphere of nothingness and the consciousness of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception are either bound to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
Or they are unbound.

Immediately after the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, in reverse sequence, entering the sphere of nothingness,ğŸ”½the mind of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the consciousness of the sphere of nothingness are either bound to the sphere of nothingness.
Or they are bound to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
Or they are unbound.
Immediately after the first meditation, in sequence, supernormally entering the third meditation,
the mind of the first meditation and the consciousness of the third meditation are either bound to the three realms or unbound.
When one enters the first meditation from the third meditation by skipping over in reverse order,
the mind of the third meditation and the mental consciousness of the first meditation, and the dharmas,
may belong to the three realms,
or may be unattached.
Up to when one enters the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception from the sphere of infinite consciousness by skipping over in the forward order,
the mind of the sphere of infinite consciousness and the mental consciousness of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, and the dharmas,
may belong to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
or may be unattached.
When one enters the sphere of infinite consciousness from the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception by skipping over in reverse order,
the mental consciousness of the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the mental consciousness of the sphere of infinite consciousness, and the dharmas,
may belong to the sphere of infinite consciousness,
may belong to the sphere of nothingness,
may belong to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
or may be unattached.
The other stages should all be explained in detail according to their characteristics.
In this way,
the forward and reverse entry into concentration has been explained.
Next, one should explain the fruits of concentration attained through entry into concentration.
Among them, the fruits of concentration are as follows:
Fourteenth, the mind of transformation.
It is said that the desire realm and the first meditative absorption each have four.
The second meditative absorption has three.
The third meditative absorption has two. The fourth meditative absorption has one.
First, the desire realm has four minds of transformation.

That is to say, the fruits of the first meditative absorption up to the fruits of the fourth meditative absorption.ğŸ”½These four minds of transformation immediately give rise to the four pure meditative absorptions in the present.
The four pure meditative absorptions immediately give rise to these four minds of transformation in the present.
Immediately after the mind of transformation that is the fruit of the first meditative absorption in the desire realm,
when the pure first meditative absorption appears in the present,
that desire realm mind and the mental consciousness of the first meditative absorption have dharmas,
either belonging to the three realms or unattached.
Immediately after the pure first meditative absorption,
when the mind of transformation that is the fruit of the first meditative absorption in the desire realm appears in the present,
that first meditative absorption mind and the mental consciousness of the desire realm have dharmas,
which are either the four sense bases or the two sense bases of the transformed object.
In this way, up to the desire realm, the fourth dhyÄna fruit, and the mind of transformation, without interval,
when the pure fourth dhyÄna appears,
that desire realm mind, the fourth dhyÄna mental consciousness and dharmas,
may belong to the three realms or be unattached. The pure fourth dhyÄna without interval,
when the desire realm, the fourth dhyÄna fruit, and the mind of transformation appear,
that fourth dhyÄna mind, the desire realm mental consciousness and dharmas,
are either the four sense bases or the two sense bases.
The remaining ten dhyÄna fruits and minds of transformation correspond to the pure dhyÄnas, and the details should be understood accordingly.
Thus, the entry into concentration and the fruits of concentration have been explained.
Next, we should explain death and rebirth.
That is to say, when one dies in the desire realm and is reborn in the first dhyÄna,
that desire realm mind, the first dhyÄna mental consciousness and dharmas,
may belong to the upper eight stages,
or may be unattached.ğŸ”½When one dies in the first dhyÄna and is reborn in the desire realm,
that first dhyÄna mind, the desire realm mental consciousness and dharmas,
Or it may be bound to the three realms.
Or it may not be bound.
When dying in the desire realm and being reborn in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
that mind of the desire realm and the mental consciousness and dharmas of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
may be bound to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception or may not be bound.
When dying in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and being reborn in the desire realm,
that mind of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the mental consciousness and dharmas of the desire realm,
may be bound to the three realms.
Or they may not be bound.
Up to when dying in the base of nothingness and being reborn in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
that mind of the base of nothingness and the mental consciousness and dharmas of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception,
may be bound to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
Or they may not be bound.
When dying in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and being reborn in the base of nothingness,
that mind of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception and the mental consciousness and dharmas of the base of nothingness,
may be bound to the base of nothingness or to the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.
Or they may not be bound.
This is called different connection.
Here there are no four corresponding same and different.
Because the mind realm and so forth are common to the nine grounds,
It is not necessarily based on the physical body to arise.
Question: How many of these six consciousnesses have discrimination?
How many are without discrimination?
Answer: The first five consciousnesses are only without discrimination.
The sixth consciousness may have discrimination,
Or it may be without discrimination.
For those in concentration, all are without discrimination.
For those not in concentration, there may be discrimination.
Because conceptual discrimination is universal and accompanies indeterminate mental consciousness.
Here it is said that the discriminating mental consciousness arises after eye consciousness.ğŸ”½Question: When the eye of the desire realm sees forms of the desire realm,
And when the eye of the form realm sees forms of the desire and form realms,
How many kinds of eye consciousness arise with regard to those forms?
How many kinds of discriminating mental consciousness arise after that with regard to those [forms]?
Answer: When those who have severed the wholesome roots see forms with the eye,
Two kinds of eye consciousness arise with regard to those forms.
Namely, defiled and non-obscuring-indeterminate.
After that, it further gives rise to three kinds of discriminating mental consciousness regarding those [sense objects].
Namely, wholesome, defiled, and non-obscuring-indeterminate.
Those who have not severed the wholesome roots, if they are ordinary beings who have not yet separated from the defilements of the desire realm,
when the eye sees forms, three kinds of eye consciousness arise regarding those forms.
Namely, wholesome, defiled, and non-obscuring-indeterminate.
After that, it further gives rise to three kinds of discriminating mental consciousness regarding those [forms] in the desire realm.
Namely, wholesome, defiled, and non-obscuring-indeterminate.
If they are born in the desire realm and have already separated from the defilements of the desire realm,
but have not yet separated from the defilements of the first concentration,
when using the eye of the desire realm to see various forms,
two kinds of eye consciousness arise regarding those forms.
Namely, excluding the defiled [kind].
After that, it further gives rise to discriminating mental consciousness regarding those [forms].
If they are of the type that regresses,
there are three kinds in the desire realm,
and two kinds in the first concentration.
If they are of the type that does not regress,
there are two kinds in the desire realm and the first concentration,
namely excluding the defiled [kind].
When one uses the eye of the first meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
at that form one produces the eye consciousness of the desire realm that is neither obscured nor unwholesome.
After that, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness at that form.
In the first meditation, there are two kinds, excluding the defiled.
In the desire realm, if one is a person who can retrogress, there are three kinds.
If one is a person who does not retrogress, there are two kinds.
When seeing the form of the first meditation,
at that form one produces the eye consciousness of the desire realm that is neither obscured nor unwholesome.
After that, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness at that form.
In the first meditation, there are three kinds.
In the desire realm, if one is a person who can retrogress, there are two kinds.
Excluding the indeterminate.
If one is a person who does not retrogress, there is only the wholesome.
That person, having already separated from the defilements of the first meditation,
has not yet separated from the defilements of the second meditation.
Using the eye of the first meditation to see the form of the desire realm,
at that form one produces the eye consciousness of the desire realm that is neither obscured nor unwholesome. After that, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness at that form.
If one is a person who can retrogress,
in the desire realm there are three kinds, and in the first meditation there are two kinds.
Those of nonretrogression in the desire realm are of two kinds.
Those of the first trance state are only wholesome.
When seeing the form of the first trance state,
with regard to that form, eye consciousness that is neither obscured nor unwholesome arises.
After that, with regard to that, discriminating mental consciousness arises.
If one is of the type subject to retrogression,
in the desire realm there are two kinds.
In the first trance state there are three kinds.
Those of the type not subject to retrogression,
in the desire realm and the first trance state, are only wholesome.
When using the eye of the second trance state to see forms of the desire realm,
with regard to those forms, eye consciousness that is neither obscured nor unwholesome arises.
After that, with regard to that, discriminating mental consciousness arises.
If one is of the type subject to retrogression,
in the desire realm there are three kinds.
In the first two trance states there are two kinds each.
Those of the type not subject to retrogression,
in the desire realm and the second trance state, are two kinds each.
In the first trance state they are only wholesome.
When seeing the form of the first trance state,
with regard to that form, eye consciousness that is neither obscured nor unwholesome arises.
After that, with regard to that, discriminating mental consciousness arises.
If one is of the type subject to regression,
in the desire realm and second meditation there are two kinds.
In the first meditation there are three kinds.
Those of the type not subject to regression have only the wholesome in the desire realm and first meditation.
In the second meditation there are two kinds.
When seeing form of the second meditation,
at that form one produces the eye consciousness that is neither morally defiled nor morally good.
After this, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness at that form.
If one is of the type subject to regression, in the desire realm and first meditation there are two kinds, and in the second meditation there are three kinds.
Those of the type not subject to regression
have only the wholesome in the desire realm and first meditation.
In the second meditation there are three kinds.
Those who have already been freed from the defilements of the second meditation but have not yet been freed from the defilements of the third meditation,
when using the eye of the first meditation to see form of the desire realm,
at that form they produce the eye consciousness that is neither morally defiled nor morally good.
After this, they again produce the discriminating mental consciousness at that form.
If one is of the type subject to regression,
in the desire realm there are three kinds.
In the first three meditations there are two kinds each.
As for those of non-retrogression,
in the desire realm and the third meditative absorption, there are two kinds.
The first two meditative absorptions are only wholesome.
When seeing form of the first meditative absorption,
with regard to that form, eye consciousness that is neither morally good nor bad arises.
After that, with regard to that, discriminating mental consciousness arises.
If one is of the type subject to retrogression,
in the desire realm and the first and third meditative absorptions, there are two kinds.
In the first meditative absorption, there are three kinds.
As for those of non-retrogression,
in the desire realm and the first two meditative absorptions, there is only the wholesome.
In the third meditative absorption, there are two kinds.
When using the eye of the second meditative absorption to see form of the desire realm,
with regard to that form, eye consciousness that is neither morally good nor bad arises.
After that, with regard to that, discriminating mental consciousness arises.
If one is of the type subject to retrogression, in the desire realm there are three kinds.
In the first two meditative absorptions, there are two kinds. As for those of non-retrogression, in the desire realm there are two kinds.
In the first two meditative absorptions, there is only the wholesome.
When seeing form of the first meditative absorption,
When seeing the form of the second dhyÄna realm, eye consciousness arises that is neither obscured nor unwholesome.
Subsequently, discriminating mental consciousness arises in regard to that form.
If one is of the type subject to regression, there are two types in the desire realm and second dhyÄna realm.
There are three types in the first dhyÄna realm.
If one is not of the type subject to regression, there is only the wholesome type in the desire realm and first two dhyÄna realms.
When seeing the form of the second dhyÄna realm,
eye consciousness arises that is neither obscured nor unwholesome in regard to that form.
Subsequently, discriminating mental consciousness arises in regard to that form.
If one is of the type subject to regression, there are two types in the desire realm and first dhyÄna realm.
There are three types in the second dhyÄna realm.
If one is not of the type subject to regression, there is only the wholesome type in the desire realm and first two dhyÄna realms.
When using the eye of the third dhyÄna realm to see the form of the desire realm,
eye consciousness arises that is neither obscured nor unwholesome in regard to that form.
Subsequently, discriminating mental consciousness arises in regard to that form.
If one is of the type subject to regression, there are three types in the desire realm and two types in the first three dhyÄna realms.
Those of the non-regressing type in the desire realm and the third meditation each have two kinds.
The first two meditations each have only the wholesome.
When seeing the form of the first meditation,
in that form one produces the eye consciousness that is neither-hindrance-nor-liberation and indeterminate.
After this, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness in regard to that.
Those of the regressing type in the desire realm and the first and third meditations each have two kinds.
Those of the non-regressing type in the desire realm and the first two meditations each have only the wholesome.
The third meditation has two kinds.
When seeing the form of the second meditation,
in that form one produces the eye consciousness that is neither-hindrance-nor-liberation and indeterminate.
After this, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness in regard to that.
Those of the regressing type in the desire realm and the first and third meditations each have two kinds.
The second meditation has three kinds.
Those of the non-regressing type in the desire realm and the first two meditations each have only the wholesome.
The third meditation has two kinds.
When seeing the form of the third meditation,
When the eye consciousness of the desire realm sees form of the desire realm, it is either wholesome, unwholesome, or non-obscuring and indeterminate.
After that, it may again give rise to discriminating mental consciousness.
For those who are liable to regress, the desire realm and the first two meditations each have two types.
The third meditation has three types.
For those who are not liable to regress, the desire realm and the first two meditations each have only the wholesome type.

The third meditation has three types. Those who have already become free from the defilements of the third meditation but have not yet become free from the defilements of the fourth meditation, when using the eye of the first meditation to see form of the desire realm,
when the eye consciousness of the desire realm sees form of the desire realm, it is either wholesome, unwholesome, or non-obscuring and indeterminate.
After that, it may again give rise to discriminating mental consciousness.
If one is liable to regress, the desire realm has three types.
The four meditations each have two types.
If one is not liable to regress, the desire realm and the fourth meditation each have two types.
The first three meditations each have only the wholesome type.
When seeing form of the first meditation,
when the eye consciousness of the first meditation sees form of the first meditation, it is either wholesome or non-obscuring and indeterminate.
After that, it may again give rise to discriminating mental consciousness.
If one is liable to retrogress, there are two kinds in the desire realm and the last three meditations.
There are three kinds in the first meditation.
If one is not liable to retrogress, there is only the wholesome in the desire realm and the first three meditations.
There are two kinds in the fourth meditation.
When one with that [type of faculties] sees forms of the desire realm with the eye of the second meditation,
at that time one produces the eye consciousness of the desire realm that is neither morally wholesome nor unwholesome with regard to those forms.
After that, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness with regard to those [forms].
If one is liable to retrogress, there are three kinds in the desire realm,
and two kinds in the four meditations.
If one is not liable to retrogress, there are two kinds in the desire realm and the fourth meditation,
and only the wholesome in the first three meditations. When seeing forms of the first meditation,
at that time one produces the eye consciousness of the first meditation that is neither morally wholesome nor unwholesome with regard to those forms.
After that, one again produces the discriminating mental consciousness with regard to those [forms].
If one is liable to retrogress, there are two kinds in the desire realm and the last three meditations,
and three kinds in the first meditation.
If one is not liable to retrogress, there is only the wholesome in the desire realm and the first three meditations.
The fourth meditative absorption is of two kinds.
When seeing the form of the second meditative absorption,
with regard to that form, one gives rise to the eye consciousness that is neither morally good nor bad nor indeterminate.
Subsequently, with regard to that [form], one again gives rise to the discriminating mental consciousness.
If one is subject to regression, the desire realm and the first, third, and fourth meditative absorptions are each of two kinds.
The second meditative absorption is of three kinds.
If one is not subject to regression, the desire realm and the first three meditative absorptions are each only morally good.
The fourth meditative absorption is of two kinds.
When one uses the eye of the third meditative absorption to see the form of the desire realm,
with regard to that form, one gives rise to the eye consciousness that is neither morally good nor bad nor indeterminate.
Subsequently, with regard to that [form], one again gives rise to the discriminating mental consciousness.
If one is subject to regression, the desire realm is of three kinds.
The four meditative absorptions are each of two kinds.
If one is not subject to regression, the desire realm and the fourth meditative absorption are each of two kinds.
The first three meditative absorptions are only morally good.
When seeing the form of the first meditative absorption,
with regard to that form, one gives rise to the eye consciousness that is neither morally good nor bad nor indeterminate.
After that, one again generates a discriminating mental consciousness with regard to those forms.
If one is of the type subject to regression, in the desire realm and the last three meditations there are two kinds, and in the first meditation there are three kinds.
If one is of the type not subject to regression, in the desire realm and the first three meditations there is only the wholesome.
In the fourth meditation there are two kinds.
When one sees forms of the second meditation,
with regard to those forms one generates an eye consciousness that is non-defined and without obstruction.
After that, one again generates a discriminating mental consciousness with regard to those forms.
If one is of the type subject to regression,
in the desire realm and the first, third, and fourth meditations there are two kinds.
In the second meditation there are three kinds.
If one is of the type not subject to regression, in the desire realm and the first three meditations there is only the wholesome.
In the fourth meditation there are two kinds.
When one sees forms of the third meditation,
with regard to those forms one generates an eye consciousness that is non-defined and without obstruction.
After that, one again generates a discriminating mental consciousness with regard to those forms.
If one is of the type subject to regression, in the desire realm and the first, second, and fourth meditations there are two kinds.
The third meditative absorption has three types.
